sen.j: 八代目 坂東 三津五郎（はちだいめ ばんどう みつごろう、1906年10月19日 - 1975年1月16日）は、歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th (October 19, 1906 - January 16, 1975) was a kabuki actor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th (October 19, 1906 - January 16, 1975) was a kabuki actor.
Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th (October 19, 1906 - January 16, 1975) was a kabuki actor.

sen.j: また、日本の俳優。
sen.e: He was also a Japanese actor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was also a Japanese actor.
He was also a Japanese actor.

sen.j: 坂東三津五郎 (7代目)の養子。
sen.e: He was an adopted son of Mitsugoro BANDO the 7th.
He was the adopted son of Mitsugoro BANDO the 7th.
He was the adopted son of Mitsugoro BANDO the 7th.

sen.j: 本名、守田 俊郎（もりた としろう）。
sen.e: His real name was Toshiro MORITA.
His real name was Toshiro MORITA.
His real name was Toshiro MORITA.

sen.j: 青年期より敵役、老役を得意とした。
sen.e: Since his youth, he specialized in playing the role of enemies and elderly characters.
Since his youth, he specialized in playing the role of an enemy and elderly characters.
Since his youth, he specialized in playing the role of an enemy and elderly characters.

sen.j: 来歴
sen.e: Career
sen.cmt: 単語集には historcal trail になってますが、この場合は career の方が適切だと思われます。
sen.e: Career
Career

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年）、市村座の「奴凧」で三代目坂東八十助を名乗り初舞台。
sen.e: In 1913, he debuted as Yasosuke BANDO the 3rd in 'Yakko Dako' (a kite with a picture of a man) at Ichimura-za Theater.
In 1913, he debuted as Yasosuke BANDO the 3rd in 'Yakko Dako' (a kite with a picture of a man) at Ichimura-za Theater.
In 1913, he debuted as Yasosuke BANDO the 3rd in 'Yakko Dako' (a kite with a picture of a man) at Ichimura-za Theater.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）6月、明治座の『鞍馬源氏』の牛若丸で六代目坂東蓑助を襲名。
sen.e: In June of 1928, he succeeded to the professional name of Minosuke BANDO the 6th, playing the role of Ushiwakamaru in "Kurama Genji" (The Genji clan, or the Minamoto clan, in Kurama) at Meiji-za Theater.

In June of 1928, he succeeded to the professional name of Minosuke BANDO the 6th, playing the role of Ushiwakamaru in "Kurama Genji" (The Genji clan, or the Minamoto clan, in Kurama) at Meiji-za Theater.

In June of 1928, he succeeded to the professional name of Minosuke BANDO the 6th, playing the role of Ushiwakamaru in "Kurama Genji" (The Genji clan, or the Minamoto clan, in Kurama) at Meiji-za Theater.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）、劇団新劇場を設立。
sen.e: He founded Shingekijo (new theater) Theater Company in 1932.
He founded the Shingekijo (new theater) Theater Company in 1932.
He founded the Shingekijo (new theater) Theater Company in 1932.

sen.j: 1962年（昭和37年）、歌舞伎座の『喜撰』で八代目坂東三津五郎を襲名。
sen.e: In 1962, he succeeded to the professional name of Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th, in "Kisen" at Kabuki-za Theater.
In 1962, he succeeded to the professional name of Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th, in "Kisen" at the Kabuki-za Theater.
In 1962, he succeeded to the professional name of Mitsugoro BANDO the 8th, in "Kisen" at the Kabuki-za Theater.

sen.j: 1973年（昭和48年）、重要無形文化財各個指定者（人間国宝）に認定。
sen.e: In 1973, he was recognized as an individual certified as an Important Intangible Cultural Asset (Living National Treasure).
In 1973, he was recognized as an individual certified as an Important Intangible Cultural Asset (Living National Treasure).
In 1973, he was recognized as an individual certified as an Important Intangible Cultural Asset (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 1975年（昭和50年）1月16日、京都南座の初春興行に出演中に死亡した。好物のトラフグの肝による中毒で急死。
sen.e: He died on January 16, 1975, while he was touring in the new year's performance at Minami-za Theater in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He died on January 16, 1975, while he was touring during the new year's performance at the Minami-za Theater in Kyoto.
He died on January 16, 1975, while he was touring during the new year's performance at the Minami-za Theater in Kyoto.

sen.j: 好物のトラフグの肝による中毒による急死だった。
sen.e: He died suddenly due to poisoning from his favorite food, tiger puffer fish liver.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He died suddenly due to poisoning from his favorite food, tiger puffer fish liver.
He died suddenly due to poisoning from his favorite food, tiger puffer fish liver.

sen.j: 68歳だった。
sen.e: He was 68 years old.
He was 68 years old.
He was 68 years old.

sen.j: 人物
sen.e: Character
Character
Character

sen.j: 歌舞伎に限らず、近代劇の創始者のひとりである小山内薫の影響を受けて、1932年（昭和7年）には劇団新劇場を設立している。
sen.e: He founded Shingekijo Theater Company, being influenced not only by kabuki but also by Kaoru OSANAI, who was one of the founders of modern theater.
He founded the Shingekijo Theater Company, being influenced not only by kabuki, but also by Kaoru OSANAI, who was one of the founders of the modern theater.
He founded the Shingekijo Theater Company in 1932, being influenced not only by kabuki, but also by Kaoru OSANAI, who was one of the founders of the modern theater.

sen.j: その後は東宝、関西歌舞伎を経て再び東京に戻った。
sen.e: He then returned to Tokyo, after spending time at Toho and Kansai Kabuki.
He then returned to Tokyo, after spending time at Toho and Kansai Kabuki.
He then returned to Tokyo, after spending time at Toho Co.,Ltd. and Kansai Kabuki.

sen.j: また、孫の坂東三津五郎 (10代目)の回想によると、八代目三津五郎は、読書家・博識家としても知られていた。
sen.e: According to a remembrance by his grandson, Mitsugoro BANDO (the 10th), Mitsugoro the 8th was known as a knowledgeable man who loved to read.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to his grandson, Mitsugoro BANDO (the 10th), Mitsugoro the 8th was known as a knowledgeable man who loved to read.
According to his grandson, Mitsugoro BANDO (the 10th), Mitsugoro the 8th was known as a knowledgeable man who loved to read.

sen.j: 役作りのために国立国会図書館に連日赴いて資料を探したというほどの勉強家であったという。
sen.e: He was so studious that he went to the National Diet Library every day in order to so some research for his roles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was so studious that he went to the National Diet Library every day in order to so some research for his roles.
He was so studious that he went to the National Diet Library every day in order to so some research for his roles.

sen.j: 加えて、八代目三津五郎は美食家としても有名であった。
sen.e: In addition, Mitsugoro the 8th was also well-known as a gastronome.
sen.cmt: 美食家は他にもgourmand, gastronomer, gastronomist等が使われるようです。
sen.e: In addition, Mitsugoro the 8th was also well-known as a gastronome.
In addition, Mitsugoro the 8th was also well-known as a gastronome.

sen.j: 自身ドンクのフランスパンが大好物だった。
sen.e: He loved baguettes from Donq (a bakery selling French-style bread founded in Kobe in 1905).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He loved baguettes from Donq (a bakery selling French-style bread founded in Kobe in 1905).
He loved baguettes from Donq (a bakery selling French-style bread founded in Kobe in 1905).

sen.j: 他にも、孫の十代目三津五郎がまだ少年だった頃、誘われるままに一緒に札幌ラーメンを食べた。
sen.e: When his grandson, Mitsugoro the 10th, was a young boy, he followed his grandfather and ate Sapporo-style ramen noodles together.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When his grandson, Mitsugoro the 10th, was a young boy, he followed his grandfather and they ate Sapporo-style ramen noodles together.
When his grandson, Mitsugoro the 10th, was a young boy, he followed his grandfather and they ate Sapporo-style ramen noodles together.

sen.j: この後で八代目三津五郎は「世の中にはこのような美味い物があるのか」と驚いたという（出典：週刊『人間国宝』、朝日新聞社）。
sen.e: Afterwards, Mitsugoro the 8th, surprised, said 'I never knew that such a delicious food like this existed in the world' (from "Ningen Kokuho" (Living National Treasures) weekly magazine, The Asahi Shimbun Company).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, Mitsugoro the 8th, surprised, said 'I never knew that such a delicious food like this existed in the world' (from "Ningen Kokuho" - Living National Treasures weekly magazine, The Asahi Shimbun Company).

Afterwards, Mitsugoro the 8th, surprised, said 'I never knew that such a delicious food like this existed in the world' (from "Ningen Kokuho" - Living National Treasures weekly magazine, The Asahi Shinbun Company).

sen.j: 東宝劇団時代に伊藤雄之助を自殺する寸前にまで追い込むなど厳しい態度で臨んでいる。
sen.e: His attitude toward acting was so stern and resolute that while he was at Toho Theater Company he pushed Yunosuke ITO to the brink of committing suicide.
His attitude toward acting was so stern and resolute that while he was at Toho Theater Company he pushed Yunosuke ITO to the brink of committing suicide.
His attitude toward acting was so stern and resolute that while he was at Toho Theater Company he pushed Yunosuke ITO to the brink of committing suicide.

sen.j: ただし、「結局は本人のためになる、いわば愛の鞭なのだ」とその事について人に漏らしていた。
sen.e: However, he mentioned to someone regarding this matter and said, 'in the end, it benefits him, and I treat him with strictness out of love.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, regarding this matter and he said, 'in the end, it benefits him, and I treat him with strictness out of love.'
However, regarding this matter and he said, 'in the end, it benefits him, and I treat him with strictness out of love.'

sen.j: 後年伊藤が大成してからは優しくなったという。
sen.e: He later became more gentle when ITO became successful.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He later became more gentle when ITO became successful.
He later became more gentle when ITO became successful.

sen.j: フグ中毒
sen.e: Puffer fish poisoning
Puffer fish poisoning
Puffer fish poisoning

sen.j: 八代目三津五郎の急死は、以後「フグ中毒」といえば「三津五郎」の名が必ず例にあげられるようになったほどの大事件だった。
sen.e: The sudden death of Mitsugoro the 8th was a major incident.
The sudden death of Mitsugoro the 8th was a major incident. Since then, 'puffer fish poisoning' was always associated with the name 'Mitugoro' as an example.
The sudden death of Mitsugoro the 8th was a major incident, and since then, 'puffer fish poisoning' was always associated with the name 'Mitugoro' as an example.

sen.j: この一件は、危険を承知の上で毒性の高い肝を実に四人前も食らげた三津五郎がいけなかったのか、フグ調理師免許を持っているはずの板前の包丁捌きがいけなかったのかで、従前にはなかった大論争を引き起こしたことでも名高い。
sen.e: This incident caused a heated debate ever to take place, regarding whether Mitsugoro was at fault for being fully aware of the danger yet literally consuming 4 servings of highly poisonous liver, or if the chef was at fault for making a mistake in cleaning the fish even though he was supposedly a licensed puffer fish chef.

This incident caused a heated debate, over whether Mitsugoro was at fault for being fully aware of the danger yet consuming 4 servings of highly poisonous liver, or if the chef was at fault for making a mistake in cleaning the fish even though he was supposedly a licensed puffer fish chef.

This incident caused a heated debate, over whether Mitsugoro was at fault for being fully aware of the danger yet consuming 4 servings of highly poisonous liver, or if the chef was at fault for making a mistake in cleaning the fish even though he was supposedly a licensed puffer fish chef.

sen.j: この事件でも、もう一皿もう一皿とねだる三津五郎に、板前がしぶしぶ料理を出したことが問題となった。
sen.e: In this incident, as with others, the fact that the chef unwillingly served the food to Mitsugoro, who kept asking for one dish after another, became an issue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this incident, as with others, the fact that the chef unwillingly served the food to Mitsugoro, who kept asking for one dish after another, became an issue.
In this incident, as with others, the fact that the chef unwillingly served the food to Mitsugoro, who kept asking for one dish after another, became an issue.

sen.j: 当時はまだフグ中毒事件を起こした調理師に刑事裁判で有罪判決が下ることは稀だった。
sen.e: Back then, it was rare for the chef, who caused puffer fish poisoning, to be found guilty in a criminal trial.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Back then, it was rare for the chef, who caused puffer fish poisoning, to be found guilty in a criminal trial.
Back then, it was rare for the chef, who caused puffer fish poisoning, to be found guilty in a criminal trial.

sen.j: しかしこの一件では、「しぶった」板前が「しくじった」ことに変わりはないとして業務上過失致死罪、及び京都府条例違反とされた。
sen.e: However, in this case, since the 'unwilling' chef still was considered 'at fault,' he was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter due to professional negligence as well as of violation of Kyoto Prefectural Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in this case, since the 'unwilling' chef was still considered 'at fault,' the chef was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter due to professional negligence as well as of being in violation of a Kyoto Prefectural Ordinance.

However, in this case, since the 'unwilling' chef was still considered 'at fault,' the chef was found guilty of involuntary manslaughter due to professional negligence as well as of being in violation of a Kyoto Prefectural Ordinance.

sen.j: 執行猶予付の禁固刑という有罪判決が出た。
sen.e: The chef was sentenced to imprisonment with parole.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The chef was sentenced to imprisonment with parole.
The chef was sentenced to imprisonment with parole.

sen.j: 「痛み分け」となり、世間を驚かせている。
sen.e: The sentencing shocked the society because both sides were held responsible.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The sentencing shocked society because both sides were held responsible.
The sentencing shocked society because both sides were held responsible.

sen.j: 家族
sen.e: His Family
His Family
His Family

sen.j: 女婿に坂東三津五郎 (9代目)。
sen.e: His daughter's husband is Mitsugoro BANDO (the 9th).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His daughter's husband is Mitsugoro BANDO (the 9th).
His daughter's husband is Mitsugoro BANDO (the 9th).

sen.j: 孫に坂東三津五郎 (10代目)と女優の池上季実子、甥に岸澤式佐11代目がいる。
sen.e: Mitsugoro BANDO (the 10th) and actress Kimiko IKEGAMI are his grandchildren, and Shikisa KISHIZAWA the 11th is his nephew.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
